answerText: Chicago[10] In this Bellow novel, a Holocaust survivor's daughter steals the manuscript of the Indian rocket scientist Dr. Govinda Lal, who wishes to escape the title location and go to the moon.
heading: NASAT |2013 | 16 | 6 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: For 10 points each, answer the following about Saul Bellow. [10] Many of Bellow's novels, such as The Adventures of Augie March, paint a portrait of this American city, also immortalized in a Carl Sandburg poem.
